summary: This bill, the 'Chesapeake National Recreation Area Act of 2025,' proposes establishing the Chesapeake National Recreation Area as part of the National Park System in Maryland and Virginia. It defines the area's boundaries, outlines land acquisition procedures, and mandates a management plan. The bill also establishes an advisory commission to advise on management and recommends studies for additional properties. It addresses coordination with existing programs like Chesapeake Gateways and covers administrative and jurisdictional aspects, including revisions to the Fort Monroe National Monument boundary.
